JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Research Assistant at Department of Pharmacy
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences
University of Copenhagen

We are looking for a highly motivated and independent research assistant in “Social and Clinical Pharmacy” to support activities in research as well as teaching to commence the 1st of August 2022.

Our research

The Social and Clinical Pharmacy group (SCP) has a long standing expertise in social and clinical pharmacy research and teaching. Social pharmacy deals with the role and use of medicines at the individual, group and societal levels and the related professional roles. Clinical pharmacy is a health specialty, which describes the activities and services of the clinical pharmacist to develop and promote the rational and appropriate use of medicinal products and devices. The focus areas of SCP are clinical pharmacy, pharmaceutical policy and medicines use. SCP also hosts the WHO Collaborating Center for Research and Training in the Patient Perspective on Medicines Use.

Your job

The successful applicant is expected to conduct teaching in subjects such as ‘social pharmacy’ and ‘the pharmacy internship’ on both bachelor and master level, and help carry out research based activities in the group mainly based on the use of qualitative methods. The position also includes other duties such as administrative tasks.

Profile

We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic research assistant with the following competencies and experience:

Essential experience and skills

  • A master in Pharmacy
  • Documented teaching experience at university level
  • Experience in research including experience in using qualitative methods
  • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
  • Teaching and research experience within one or more of the SCP group’s focus areas: clinical pharmacy, pharmaceutical policy and medicines use
Place of employment

The place of employment is at Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen. We offer creative and stimulating working conditions in a dynamic and international research environment.

Terms of employment

The average weekly working hours are 37 hours per week.

The position is a fixed-term position limited to a period of 1 ½ years. The starting date is 1st of August 2022.

Employment will be in accordance with the provisions of the collective agreement between the Danish Ministry of Finance and AC (the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations). The monthly salary will be based on the number of years of work experience (seniority) with the possibility to negotiate a salary supplement based on prior experiences and qualifications. The employer will pay an additional 17.1 % to your pension fund.

Questions

For further information regarding the position, please contact Associate Professor Susanne Kaae; email: susanne.kaae@sund.ku.dk.

Application

Your application should in English include:

  • Letter of application addressing the requirements (max. one page).
  • Curriculum Vitae
  • A certified/signed copy of certificate(s) of education
Please submit your application by clicking on “Apply Now” below. Only online applications will be accepted.

Application deadline: 11 May 2022, 23.59 CET

We reserve the right not to consider material received after the deadline, and not to consider applications that do not live up to the abovementioned requirements.

Interviews are expected to be held in week 24.

The University of Copenhagen wish to reflect the diversity of society and encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of personal background.
